qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Marketing, Advertising, Retailing, Sales Studio 6

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Marketing, Advertising, Retailing, Sales Studio 7

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the practice of accounting, including procedures and systems to collect, measure and record business transactions, and the preparation of financial statements, including the use of basic accounting software.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Accounting Systems and Technology will focus on the design and implementation of accounting systems. Consideration will be given to the  influence of, technology, data analysis and risk management within the context in which accounting information is produced.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces key components of information systems (people, hardware, software, networks, data) and how these components are integrated and managed for business operations, decision making, collaboration, and competitive advantage.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A focus on the key decisions relevant to businesses at various stages of their development. Introduces fundamental accounting and finance principles and tools that inform business decision making. Using a business case study to track the evolution of a business from the founding individual's conception and execution, through to public listing of the company, relevant business decisions will be identified (including potential social impacts).

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An Introduction to basic economic and legal principles, and their contribution to the functioning of society. The behaviour of individuals, firms and markets will be analysed. Key aggregate economic indicators and the role of the New Zealand Reserve Bank in relation to government policy will be analysed. A general overview of the legal system in New Zealand alongside the Treaty of Waitangi will be provided and students will be introduced to business contractual obligations.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to human behavioural aspects of organisations at the individual and group level, as well as an exploration of consumers' behaviour and decision-making processes. The perspectives of the 'thinker' or decision-maker is that of both the employee /manager and of the customer / consumer.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to key issues and trends shaping the future of business. Concepts and frameworks will be applied to describe and explain the way that developments in the global economy, digital technology and the natural environment affect local and global stakeholders.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Students will learn how organisations use data to create value.? This paper has a strong focus on case studies. The paper provides real-life examples of how a variety of organisations use data analytics.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Introduction to Programming for Business Analytics
prescriptor: This paper introduces students to fundamental programming skills required to use data for decision making. The paper focuses on how to import, transform, describe and visualise data. The paper makes use of various, data, graphical and analytical packages to perform these actions. Relevant statistical skills will be covered.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Skills and capabilities based on theoretical knowledge in the areas of written, oral, interpersonal and group communication. The content of the course is at all stages made relevant to the students needs both for their course of study and their role in the workplace.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the basics of computer programming to equip students for a career in any branch of IT, the sciences, data analysis or engineering. The fundamentals of writing, designing and testing programs will be developed.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides a wide-ranging, multidisciplinary introduction to the evolution and application of increasingly complex and powerful computer systems (and other forms of digital technology) with particular emphasis on their impact on society.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an introduction to IT infrastructure concepts in order to enable students to understand computer systems architecture for effective configuration and use. Concepts of single user, multi-user, centralised, and operating systems are covered, along with applications and end-user computing.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces the process of program design and implementation using object-oriented programming, with particular emphasis on applications from Computer Science and engineering technology.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Presents an integrated approach to data communications and computer networking principles, building on IT infrastructure concepts. These concepts are applied in a network environment starting with the application layer and progressing through to the data link layer.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces programming concepts through the use of structured scripting to move and manipulate multimedia objects, such as images, audio and video files. Aspects of interpreting system feedback, identifying errors and developing coding best practice are also covered.  This elective paper provides students with an opportunity to learn and practice programming through structured activities that can be built on in more advanced programming papers.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Extends on concepts and skills taught in Economics and Society. Through the development and application of fundamental mathematical tools, the relationship between Economics and Business is analysed. The microeconomic component analyses the behaviour of individuals, firms and markets. The macroeconomic component analyses aggregate economic activity in New Zealand and its interrelationships with the rest of the world.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces coding and computer programming to business students. Basic statistical concepts and methods will be incorporated in order to provide students with all necessary tools to conduct business analysis. By the end of this paper, students will have an understanding of how data usage and analytics improve business operations and decision making. Applications of these concepts in business settings are emphasised throughout this paper.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To provide the knowledge and skills required to build a scalable switched and routed computer network.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces the process of program design and implementation using object-oriented programming, with particular emphasis on applications from Computer Science and engineering technology.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces the process of program design and implementation using object-oriented programming, with particular emphasis on applications from Computer Science and engineering technology.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The development of a broad understanding of the methods and skills needed for entrepreneurship and innovation and how these can be used to create new products, services, and ventures.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the basic aspects of finance theory, standard financial formulas, and their application. Students will develop technical skills for solving financial problems, as well as financial decision-making skills.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces the principles of communication, knowledge, academic and scientific literacy.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to enterprise information systems, the relevant processes, controls and reports in an information technology environment, and Information System development methodologies.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides a general overview of the New Zealand legal system and examines the legal environment within which business operates in New Zealand.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the fundamentals of marketing as a discipline that identifies customer needs and wants, determines which target markets the firm can serve best, and designs appropriate products, services, and communications tailored to these markets.? It provides students the foundations for customer focused value creation.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an introduction to the mathematical concepts required for an understanding of the analysis of data and applications in computing, science, and engineering. Topics include: sets, functions, series, limits, calculus, probability and statistics.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Gives the student an understanding of differential and integral calculus, and develops the ability to formulate and solve models of simple engineering and scientific systems.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Gives the student a solid foundation in algebra and discrete mathematics, providing essential background for further study in many fields of Science and Engineering, particularly those utilizing ideas from Mathematics or Computer Science.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction and exploration of the purpose, processes and practices of managing and organising. The basics of; organisational culture, structure, functions, management thinking and behaviours will be examined. Challenges for managers in a range of contexts will be explored.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to applied statistics. Provides techniques for describing and summarising a data set. Delivers an understanding of how to use a sample to infer the properties of the population it was taken from. Students in this course also learn how to use statistical software to undertake descriptive analysis as well as perform statistical inference.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The focus is on addressing our current state of unsustainability, and exploring new leadership thinking that can move us towards a sustainable future. Specifically, it focuses on developing the mindset and competencies necessary for sustainability leadership including critical self-reflection, relationship building, influencing and systems thinking.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Builds on the accounting concepts and practices that students have acquired in the first year papers.  On completion of the paper students will be able to understand and evaluate the accounting principles and apply current accounting practices associated with New Zealand companies.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces students to management accounting and to provide an understanding of:  Systems and procedures for costing products, and using cost data for decision making; Preparing budgets for cost management and internal reporting; and current developments in management accounting.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces the New Zealand taxation system and its administration to determine how taxes are calculated for individuals and business organisations. It is aimed at students who require a general knowledge of the tax system as part of their future accounting and/or business practice.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper aims to make the students understand the features of the accounting profession and the legal and regulatory environment in which it operates with a view to be able to appreciate the role of accounting in its societal setting.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Focuses on the analysis of financial statements and the assessments of an organisation's performance, including capital and cash budgeting. Develops an understanding of appropriate accounting tools and techniques used to measure and assess risk and value.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An analysis of the key concepts, practices and issues in accounting and reporting for social and environmental issues for a range of business and social enterprises.  The particular focus is on the reporting mechanisms and media enterprises might use to account for their social responsibility as well as indicators used to improve and communicate performance towards sustainability goals.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Develop an appreciation of business processes as organisational strategic assets; understand the business process management life cycle and apply business process management concepts to model existing (as-is) process diagrams, systematically analyse weaknesses and provide improvement alternatives with supporting rationales.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Identify data problems in a poorly designed data structure; design and implement a database to manage structured data in a relational database environment that supports business operations and satisfies integrity rules and normalisation requirements.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Focuses on developing a theoretical and practical understanding of managing projects throughout the project life cycle.  Reviews the processes, tools, team and leadership skills which play an active part in managing projects.  Topics include teamwork, project leadership, tools for effective project management, defining the project, creating the project plan, tracking and monitoring the project, contract and partnership, and project reviews and audit.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An examination of the practical tools and techniques that enable the efficient use of an organisation's resources. Topics include value chain/supply chain management, capacity management, scheduling, decision tools, quality tools and systems, facilities management, product/service development, benchmarking and world class quality performance.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Addresses procurement management for both goods and services, for the private sector as well as for the public sector. It covers a wide range of procurement decisions including the make-or-buy decision, supplier selection, contracts and negotiations, goods/services acquisitions, enabling information systems and technologies, and environmental and ethical concerns in procurement. It introduces professional procurement practices and discusses contemporary issues.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper builds on BUSS506 and examines how business can act responsibly in a contemporary environment. It provides students with the tools to evaluate and address ethical issues at an individual and organisational level. Different approaches to doing business in a socially and environmentally responsible way are considered.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A one semester or one year exchange paper that will allow a professional studies component of the International Business major in the Bachelor of Business degree to be completed overseas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A one semester or one year exchange paper that will allow a professional studies component of the International Business major in the Bachelor of Business degree to be completed overseas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Students will learn about and work with systems that integrate, organise, store, and manage the data used for business analytics. They will investigate the strategic and operational implications of these activities, and the optimal way they can be structured to meet organisational requirements and constraints. Topics covered include data warehousing, the extract-transform-load (ETL) process and constructing organisational performance measures, among others.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper prepares students to apply predictive analytics techniques in business. Students will learn how predictive analytics can be used to improve business decision-making. Students will practice the learned methods using open source software.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides students with the core competencies of project management in an information technology context. A range of IT project management methodologies and approaches are compared. Some proven practices and supporting tools and techniques are further investigated, particularly with regard to planning, monitoring, estimating and implementing. Expected standards of professionalism and ethics will be highlighted.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an introduction to IT Service Science and its role in the development and provision of high quality IT services. The foundations of high quality services are covered, including standard procedures, techniques and tools. Students will gain IT service and operations orientated skills.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Extends individual software development skills into a team environment. Students are exposed to common and emergent practices in the field and introduced to a range of tools that support development processes and practices.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the design and construction of object- oriented software. It will extend individual design and programming skills developed in earlier programming papers, with an emphasis on the quality, modularity and reusability of the software developed. The paper will introduce current techniques used in software development that allow the goals of software development projects to be realised.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the design and construction of object- oriented software. It will extend individual design and programming skills developed in earlier programming papers, with an emphasis on the quality, modularity and reusability of the software developed. The paper will introduce current techniques used in software development that allow the goals of software development projects to be realised.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To lay a foundation for the use and understanding of information from a computational perspective This paper will prepare students to identify sources of information, their advantages and limitations and the application of information to real-world problems. The transformation of data to knowledge represents a key objective of this paper.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Addresses security technology and systems; basic cryptography and public key infrastructure, physical security, logical security, access controls, securing networks, network operations, systems, databases and applications, mobile and wireless security, web-services security, and security strategies for e-commerce. The intrinsic relationship between security technologies, ethics, legal and regulatory requirements, forensics and fraud, business strategy, and risk management is addressed.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Issues, skills and strategies associated with providing core services over a network in a multi user environment. The student will also learn about fine tuning of networked systems for optimum delivery in terms of security, cost and speed.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Theoretical and practical skills for the utilisation of mathematical structures and algorithms for handling data that are essential in computational mathematics and computer science. Static and dynamic structures for data, cloning data, mathematical concepts of iteration and recursion, analysis of performance and complexity, data searching and data sorting algorithms, mathematical logic and formal grammars.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Algorithmic analysis, concurrency algorithms, design patterns, design techniques, advanced data structures, graph algorithms, numerical algorithms.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A practical foundation in high-level computer graphics programming and a comprehensive overview of proven graphics algorithms and software techniques is presented with a focus on those techniques that have become common currency in the field of interactive computer graphics.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the logical and combinatorial tools and methods used in mathematics and computer science, with an emphasis on axiomatic systems, combinatorial principles, and automated reasoning.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Survey of intermediate-level microeconomic concepts, theories and applications. This paper analyses the economic behaviour of individuals and firms, and the structure and functioning of markets.  It covers the economics of uncertainty, information, game theory, externalities and public goods with extensive real-world applications.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A comprehensive survey of intermediate-level macroeconomic concepts, theories and applications. This paper analyses the economy as a whole focusing on the determinants of economic growth, employment, inflation, interest rates and the balance of payments.  It considers explanations of short-run fluctuations in employment and output, the influence of public policies and the goals of macroeconomic policy with extensive use of real-world applications.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces empirical research methods in economics with applications to business decision-making problems.  This paper emphasises the use and interpretation of regression techniques, with practical computer-based training.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To provide students with a conceptual and practical understanding of the theoretical frameworks for analysing employment relations.  This includes analysing the institutions, processes and practices which are crucial to the workings of contemporary employment relations in New Zealand.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To provide the knowledge and skills required to build a scalable switched and routed Wide Area Network.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides students with a comprehensive understanding of both the theoretical principles and techniques in corporate finance and to enable students to apply such principles and techniques in real-world business situations.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the theory and practice of investments, with special emphasis on investment criteria, sources of information and types of financial investments. Develop an understanding of the organization and function of securities market, investment alternatives, and valuation of securities. Explore sources of investment information, introduce the major approaches to investment selection, analyse the relationship of risk to required rates of returns, portfolio construction and monitoring.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the functioning of domestic and global financial markets and various types of financial institutions, including the Reserve Bank of New Zealand and various types of short- and long-term financial securities.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Personal Finance focuses on developing financial capability and understanding financial products that individuals and small business owners are exposed to. The paper will develop core competencies in budgeting, managing debt, and savings and investments, and apply these competencies to real-world applications that have direct implications to the student.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The paper focuses on using programming, statistics and data to solve real world business problems. While building valuable programming and statistical skills, this paper will be driven by the need to generate intelligence from data that can drive business decisions. This includes using libraries to study the relationships between variables and automate analytical tasks. It applies these techniques in practical business problems that can be solved using these methods.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To provide students with a conceptual and practical understanding of the importance of effective human resource management principles and practices.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An investigation of the strategic context and principles that drive development of learning in current and future workplaces. Students will also explore operational issues associated with learning and development to gain an understanding of best practice.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A practical foundation in high-level computer graphics programming and a comprehensive overview of proven graphics algorithms and software techniques is presented with a focus on those techniques that have become common currency in the field of interactive computer graphics.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides students with the essential concepts, principles, and techniques of database management systems. Specifically, the paper provides an in-depth understanding of data modelling and database design concepts. The retrieval language will be covered in detail. The balanced approach of theory and practice will provide students with a better understanding of the issues and problems involved in database design and development.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Covers database design from a performance perspective. Presents a complete view of the Database Design process from Requirements Analysis to Database Deployment on an actual Database server. Issues such as Data Storage, Security, Concurrency Control, Query Optimisation, Access Paths, Application Tuning and Data Warehousing are covered in depth. Overall, the course develops the ability to deal with the technical aspects of database administration in an enterprise scale database system.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Focuses on skills required to identify a user's information technology solution requirements: to investigate and evaluate suitable solutions including software, platform and vendors, to plan the acquisition of a solution, to identify training requirements, and to plan a training programme using various delivery methods including flexible/blended delivery.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Students will gain a thorough grounding in analysis of the global macro context.  Through an investigation of key trends in the global environment and country characteristics, students will develop research skills in sourcing, evaluating and presenting data for strategic insight.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Students will gain a grounding in international business theory and practice.  Motives and forms of internationalisation, introduction to outsourcing and the management of the international supply-chain, issues in operating across national, cultural, economic and financial boundaries borders are examined. The paper examines how international businesses operate, including organisational culture and introduction to cross-cultural management.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introductory paper that focuses on strategic thinking and the analysis of organisational and environmental situations in order to evolve and implement business plans. Students will learn the tools and frameworks to conduct industry and organisational analysis, formulate and evaluate strategic options, and consider strategic implementation.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper aims to provide students with a general overview of the various types and features of contemporary business entities and trading arrangements and introduce legal and ethical principles affecting commercial and business relationships between stakeholders including investors, owners, managers and office bearers of various entities.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Research in Marketing, Advertising, Retailing, Sales
prescriptor: An in-depth examination of how data can be sourced, analysed, interpreted and reported in order to inform effective decision-making by marketing, advertising, retailing and sales organisations.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An examination of the relational factors within a marketing, advertising, retailing and sales informed environment. Under these frameworks students will develop insights into how consumer, buyer and shopper relationships are impacted in a contemporary business and network-driven landscape.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The aim of this paper is to provide learners with a comprehensive understanding of the concepts pertaining to various individual and environmental factors that influence consumers' information processing and decision-making process and to explore the strategic implications of consumption behaviours for marketers.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The elements of actuarial mathematics: securities, annuities, mortality laws, life annuities, life insurance policy values.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An examination of the behavioural aspects of organisations at the individual, group and organisational levels.  Topics include ability, personality, perception, attitudes and values, stress, learning, job satisfaction and motivation, groups and teams, power and politics, conflict and communication.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Management of Small and Medium Sized Enterprises (SMEs)
prescriptor: An introduction to entrepreneurship and issues affecting small and medium enterprises.  To provide a conceptual and practical understanding of entrepreneurship and management principles and practices in small and medium enterprises.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To acquaint students with contemporary models of leadership and change at the individual, group and organisational levels, in business, government and non-profit organisations.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Managing in Aotearoa: Indigenous and Critical Perspectives
prescriptor: An introduction to critical systems of thought on management and organising from Indigenous and non-western theoretical perspectives. Grounded in the historical, political, cultural and economic realities of Aotearoa New Zealand, students will be encouraged to connect their own experiences and identities to the concept of Indigeneity in the context of Aotearoa and to think innovatively about management and organisations

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an introduction to a branch of statistics that deals with the study of chance. Delivers access to a range of techniques for modelling and analysing probability problems in real-life settings.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A study of statistical methods suitable for a range of applications in science, engineering and business.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to forecasting in business and economics using statistical models. Making predictions from data that arise sequentially in time (e.g. annual electricity production, unemployment rates, share prices, global temperature series). Topics include forecasting strategies, detecting trends, autoregressive models, and simulation.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Starting from an analysis of the various environmental issues related to business activity, the focus is on how business organisations can and should respond to these issues. Strong analytical and negotiation skills are promoted as students are required to analyse scientific, political, moral and economic dimensions of environmental issues facing business and negotiate sustainable outcomes for numerous stakeholders.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Enables students to evaluate an existing accounting information system, and to design and implement improved accounting information systems and the internal controls necessary to satisfy management requirements.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides an understanding of financial accounting within New Zealand and an advanced application of Financial Reporting Standards. The paper also critically examines contemporary issues in financial reporting including the application of the financial reporting framework.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To prepare and evaluate management accounting information for cost management, control, and decision-making by applying current developments in management accounting theory and practice, taking into consideration both qualitative and quantitative approaches to decision-making. In addition to being technically competent, students will be able to recognise the importance of inter-relationships with other disciplines and critically apply various techniques in strategic management accounting.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To develop students' understanding of the role and practice of external auditors in accordance with professional and statutory requirements

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The purpose of this course is to examine the accounting function from an international perspective. It has two central themes weaving the various topical issues. These themes are the impact of variations in cultural and belief systems on the theory and practice of accounting, and the determinants and consequences of adopting specific accounting practices in a multinational organisation. Specific issues examined incl. accounting regulations, financial reporting issues, disclosure and transparency

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The aim of this paper is to explore key concepts, practices and issues in Not-for-profit accounting, including charity regulatory requirements, key stakeholders' information needs, Not-for-profit performance measurement and reporting, and Not-for-profit commercialisation.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an understanding of the theoretical and practical issues related to the acquisition, implementation and application of Enterprise Information Systems within organisations, including the motivations for acquiring; challenges associated with implementing; process integration inherent in  and impact these systems have on key business processes. Students will develop work plans for implementation and use SAP software through computer-based training materials and hands-on experience.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Explores the issues in and approaches to managing information systems in organisations, including information systems planning and architecture, governance and alignment with business strategy.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A critical examination of the development of eBusiness strategy in organisations as well as day to day managerial issues that face organisations in an eBusiness environment. Topics include value-chains, supply-chains, eFulfilment, strategic implications of the internet, strategic collaborations and alliances, telework, virtual teams, changing systems of knowledge and learning, leveraging investment, impact of technology and the measurement of effectiveness.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Using a holistic systems approach to map and understand current supply chain management and logistics practices upstream to include demand chain management and downstream to include customer relationship management.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper provides advanced study of a special interest topic that can be multi-disciplinary or inter-disciplinary or within a discipline area. The area of the special topic may vary from each semester or year, and also between discipline areas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An overview of design thinking as a problem solving approach. Students will work in an interdisciplinary team and create value for a real business or organisation. Using a design thinking methodology, students will develop preferred solutions to a contemporary complex issue or problem which adds value to a business or organisation and takes into account responsible business practice.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A one semester or one year exchange paper that will allow a professional studies component of the International Business major in the Bachelor of Business degree to be completed overseas.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper focuses on identifying and implementing data strategy for business organizations. It investigates the ways data can be translated into useful insights for gaining competitive advantage. Students will learn how to identify strategic data needs, create data infrastructure and put the data strategy into practice. Students will work on a real world business case that can involve sourcing combining and analysing data as well as developing a data strategy.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Language and vision are fundamental to human perception and cognition, yet there is relatively little understanding of how the two interact or operate together at a system level to aid learning and recognition. This paper covers fundamental and advanced aspects of language (especially text) and vision from an artificial intelligence perspective. The primary focus is on practical algorithms, tools and systems of text, vision intelligence, as well as their performance evaluation. Techniques of representing information in semi-formal languages such as Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML) and free text are compared. The issues associated with representation and extraction of information encapsulated in textual and visual formats, such as the semantic unit perceived as an event, will be explored. Examples of text and visual modelling techniques such as probabilistic and vector models will be used to illustrate AI applications.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an overview of the fundamentals of nature inspired computing (NIC), particularly in the fields of evolutionary algorithms, swarm intelligence, artificial life, DNA computing and quantum computing. Real world applications in optimization, simulation and modeling will be introduced in workshops and recent advances presented and analysed.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An investigation of a defined topic in a supervised programme of readings.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An investigation into a selected area whether that be a specific problem domain, or an area of business opportunity. The project is typically an original investigation but considerable flexibility is allowed. Typically projects will involve either commercial software development for live clients, commercial research and development projects on behalf of live clients, or supervised research projects into selected areas of interest.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A practical foundation in game programming, using a variety of game development tools and programming libraries, and deploying games on a variety of platforms.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A rigorous exploration into the Theory of Computer Science providing a mathematically sound presentation of the theory of computer science including formal languages and models of computation, as well as an introduction to computational complexity.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Surveys the theoretical and practical aspects of modern programming languages, including their design and implementation, program translation, virtual machines, and different programming pradigms.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Investigates the design and implementation of distributed systems, including contemporary technologies such as Java Enterprise Edition and .NET, as well as the development of mobile systems.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This course reviews the advancement in data communications and networking supporting distributed systems incorporating components from current Networking protocols and products.. It applies relevant theoretical models for the evaluation, selection and deployment of advanced network technologies providing specified services.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an in-depth understanding of LAN, WAN and Wireless security focusing on the functionality available and configuration of network and link layers.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides an in-depth understanding of LAN, WAN and Wireless security focusing on the functionality available and configuration of network and link layers.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The aim of this paper is to understand the nature of intelligent systems and how such a system may be implemented.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A holistic view of how information security is managed in an organisation, examining its relationship with laws, ethics, culture, standards. Includes the examination of the frameworks, processes, and measures as well as practical problems involved in building secure operational environments for businesses and individual users. Develops the ability to design secure information technology environments.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Furthers understanding of the factors (psychological, ergonomic, organisational, social etc) that determine how people operate and make use of computer technology effectively.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provides students with the core competencies of project management together with an appreciation of professional ethics and practice related to the introduction and life cycle of information systems and services in organisations.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Extends the students' knowledge of data communications and internetworking over the World Wide Web, to cover issues associated with development of applications in this environment. Emphasis is upon the analysis, design and development of web-based applications for a variety of purposes using current tools and techniques.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces students to the exciting world of Data Mining. Organisations have, over time, accumulated vast amounts of valuable data which, when exploited appropriately will give them a significant competitive advantage over their rivals who merely "crunch" data. Data Mining is an area that has come of age - well proven techniques and tools are widely available. Covers popular mining techniques as well as providing specific hands-on experience using a publicly available tool.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Demonstrates effective analysis of the role of IT in health care and the Primary, Secondary and Public health levels. Identifies the appropriate use of technologies involved in health informatics including coding, diagnosis and communication systems as well as the electronic medical record. Topics include ethical and practical considerations for the effective use of health informatics along with the use of evidence to guide practice.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Explores advanced capabilities in an applied approach to the development of blockchain applications. Topics include consensus models, public key cryptography, and hashing methods to peer-to-peer distributed network architectures, critically analyses blockchain-specific use cases and solutions.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An advanced topic-based paper, which explores the intellectual architecture of modern microeconomics highlighting the contributions of several Nobel prizewinners.  The paper is organized around four central themes: markets, risk, strategy and information.  The emphasis is on using microeconomic models to better understand the workings of a variety of real-world markets and other economic institutions.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An advanced topic-based paper, which analyses modern macroeconomic models and policies. This paper explores topics such as economic growth, business cycles, consumption, investment, fiscal policy, monetary policy and open economy macroeconomics.   The topics covered are relevant to policy makers and practitioners.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An application of econometric models and methods to a wide range of practical problems.  This paper explores common regression techniques in a variety of real life case studies.  It develops and applies appropriate econometric tools to the analysis of cross-sectional, time series and panel data.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An analysis of firm behaviour and market outcomes under imperfect competition.  Game theory is used to understand strategic firm behaviour in various market settings.  This paper explores modern industrial organisation topics relevant to consumers, firms, consultants and practitioners, with particular emphasis on public policy instruments like regulation and competition policy.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An examination of natural resources and the social construction of value and the role they play in environmental and ecological economic approaches. Essential concepts and theory for economic analysis, policy and related allocation of renewable and non-renewable resources are covered, as well as  methods for the economic assessment of costs and benefits of natural resources.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An economic analysis of the development process in low-income countries.  Applies economic analysis to the major issues affecting the growth and development in selected countries. The prospects and challenges of sustaining growth and development will be evaluated with the aid of macroeconomic data.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Economics of Labour and Health Policy
prescriptor: Examines and analyses economic concepts that underpin labour and health policy. Topics covered include: labour demand and supply; human capital theory; compensating wage differentials; migration theory; health care prioritisation; and socio-economic determinants of health.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces students to fundamental principles in international trade economics, linking traditional and modern trade theories to analyse events in the world economy. International trade policy issues facing developed and developing economies as a result of globalisation are analysed.  Economic models are used to identify and understand the merits and demerits of protectionism and trade liberalization.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to the history of long-run economic growth and related changes in population and social and economic institutions. Theories of economic growth, economic and social organisation, and business cycles are examined and evaluated against the historical record. Methodological debates around the relationship between economic history and economics and history are explored.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Critically examines employment regulations, institutions and dispute resolution practices. The focus is on examining New Zealand employment regulations issues and outcomes.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Workplace Health, Safety and Conflict Management
prescriptor: A multidisciplinary approach to health, safety and workplace conflict management. Processes for worker participation in development and implementation of health,? safety and conflict management systems are examined.? Investigation, risk evaluation, negotiation and conflictmanagement are practised by simulation.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Critically examines employment regulations and institutions in New Zealand. The paper used contemporary issues to explore the genesis and shaping of legislation through the socio/political policy making process. The role and impact of policy, regulations and legislation on parties to the employment relationship is also explored.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper aims to further develop your understanding of the concepts and methods required for the construction of large software intensive systems. The paper develops a broader understanding of the discipline of software engineering to provide exposure to the full range of techniques and processes associated with the development of complex software intensive systems.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An exploration of how multiple kinds of wealth (social, financial, ecological) can be achieved by exploring the intersection of community, economic, and environmental systems. The focus is on the merging of social, commercial, and technical expertise to develop products and ventures that can address social and ecological issues.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The paper examines different business models for commercializing innovations. Business model building is explored for different types of innovation such as radical versus incremental, predominantly in the new venture context.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A study of the international financial markets and activities of multinational organisations. Examination of the issues of foreign exchange and country risk as they apply to firms operating across national boundaries and various management techniques and approaches used to manage such risks.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A focus on concepts and tools used in covering financial risks of investments and financial transactions. The paper will include study of modern financial derivatives and their usage in reducing risk. Additionally, the paper demonstrates the relevance of finance theory and techniques to New Zealand businesses operating within global markets.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To provide students with an applied view of finance for entrepreneurs, start-ups and small firms. It offers an integrated set of concepts and applications from finance, entrepreneurship, and accounting theories and practices. The paper will prepare students for the challenges facing young and innovative firms.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Introduces students to the application of various financial models within the context of excel with a focus on applying the models to real-world situations.  Students will also be introduced to collecting financial data using several databases including DataStream, NZ Deep Archive and Osiris.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Wealth Management focuses on the process of developing and implementing a financial plan. Issues related to an investor's profile, their asset allocation strategies, insurance and taxation will be studied. Furthermore, the different characteristics and features of a range of financial instruments such as stocks, bonds, mutual funds, property and commodities will be explored.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Critically examines diversity management using a multi-level macro (country/region), meso (organisational) and micro (individual) framework. Inequalities in work and organisations, and ways to build inclusiveness in organisational life are addressed.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An examination of global mobility within an international and cross cultural context. Students will critically reflect on strategies driving internationalisation and the resultant organisational structures. International talent management, career models, HRM issues and practices for optimal and ethical organisational outcomes, future HRM trends and individual career management within a contemporary global labour market are also explored.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Focuses on skills required to identify a user's information technology solution requirements: to investigate and evaluate suitable solutions including software, platforms, and vendors, to plan the acquisition of a solution, to critically analyse the models and methodologies used in the requirements analysis and acquisition process.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Examines the practice and theory of IT Services Management with a focus on industry best practices in managing information technology in an organisation. Such practices are put in context through the presentation of an overall framework for aligning IT strategies with business strategies, monitoring, evaluating and improving IT operations performance, and auditing the relevant processes.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: A critical analysis of the service techniques and procedures required to provide supervision, technical support, IT operations services and customer service in an IT operations environment.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Examines the relationships and capabilities of Information Systems in global information economies. The analysis, design and implementation of IS is examined, along with the use of enabling technologies to engineer Information Systems across diverse organisations.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: In-depth examination of contemporary issues in the global business environment and business. The implications for MNEs, countries and the future of international business will be addressed. The paper will require students to take a critical perspective on current global developments in the management of international firms, trade and the global business environment.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This paper advances strategic management knowledge and skills to deepen understanding of international business strategy and implementation in challenging, dynamic and complex global contexts. The paper focuses on developing advanced business research skills to formulate strategic management insight for decision-making.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: This advanced paper examines the processes of innovation within established corporations. Types and modes of innovation and appropriation regimes are explored.  The paper examines corporate entrepreneurship, how firms grow through alliances, networks and acquisition of start-ups. Issues around managing technology transfer, born-global firms and supporting innovation are examined.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Builds marketing and market insights to design, develop and evaluate appropriate strategies and tactics for successful marketing performance.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Develops an appreciation through marketing, advertising, retailing and sales insights of the elements and influencers that enable effective recognition, construction and formulation of communications in an omni-channel environment.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Digital, Social Media and Mobile Marketing
prescriptor: An applied paper framed by relevant marketing theory and emerging theoretical insights exploring how the digital transformation of marketing is reflected in novel market behaviours, consumer interactions and experiences, and how the work of marketers will continue to evolve in a post-digital environment.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Explores the way companies are designing their brand strategies, points of differentiation, positioning and brand names to attract sports consumers and participants. Develops an understanding of the value of marketing from the sponsor/brand side and emphasizes the elements critical to effective, multifocal and strategic marketing in sports. Structured around the management of sports brands and examines sports consumers' cognitive, emotional and behavioural responses to those brands.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The paper concerns international sales management in both bricks and mortar and online service organisations. It covers a wide range of strategic and operational decisions in contemporary global business environments. Industry best practices in professional sales management and global example cases (including tied agents, brokers and independent contractors) are discussed throughout the paper.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Explore insights into media channel planning and implementation in communication strategies from the perspective of consumer psychology. Topics include the role of media in strengthening involvement between consumers and brands through the management of media strategy in advertising. Topics are evaluated in the context of an explosion of new communication opportunities and the consumer's changing lifestyles.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: To critically evaluate the changing retail landscape and ways in which retailers and retail designers can create retail experiences that enables them to operate profitably and in a socially conscious way.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Develops an appreciation through marketing, advertising, retailing and sales insights of the elements and influencers that enable effective recognition, construction and formulation of communications in an omni-channel environment.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Digital, Social Media and Mobile Marketing B
prescriptor: An applied paper framed by relevant marketing theory and emerging theoretical insights exploring how the digital transformation of marketing is reflected in novel market behaviours, consumer interactions and experiences, and how the work of marketers will continue to evolve in a post-digital environment.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An in-depth examination of the complex interdependency of private, public and Not-for-Profit organisations and wider societal concerns. Using a broader set of questions the meanings and reciprocal nature of social impact management is explored. A critical lens examines a selection of contemporary issues to gauge the implications of business decisions on interpretations of social impact.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An examination of stress and resilience at work, including theoretical models. Students will critically evaluate the causes and consequences of stress and resilience. A range of approaches to managing stress and improving resilience at work are explored.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Provide students with an understanding of, and ability, to apply risk management principles, frameworks, processes and techniques in different settings.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
paper_name: Organising for the Future of Work
prescriptor: An in-depth examination of the contemporary and future work environments. Students will critically reflect on how a changing world requires new approaches to organisation, management and leadership.  Digital transformation and innovation  will also be examined for how they influence the nature of work and society at the individual and organisational level.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: The focus of this paper is the application of stochastic models to analyse real-life scenarios.  Key stochastic processes are studied via their mathematical properties and simulation. Models are fitted to data taken from a range of applications.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: An introduction to data management for analytics suitable for applications in business, finance, industry, and government.  Topics include: querying, cleaning, manipulating, and displaying data;   programming skills and methods suitable for handling large data sets.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Collection and analysis of data in an industrial and business context. Control charts, experimental design, samples and surveys. Analysis of data using analytics software.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Business and Bachelor of Computer and Information Sciences Conjoint
prescriptor: Student - staff partnership' advances the idea of students as co-creators of knowledge and involves students directly in curriculum. Students will function as program consultants to the SUSE Major and manage their own AUT curriculum related projects within it. Through implementation students gain practical experience from designing their own learning goals, setting assessment criteria, and evaluating and sharing their learning. The project can involve exploring new opportunities, reviewing existing processes, educating level 5 and 6 students and evaluating performance.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: Development of verbal, oral, written and graphic communication within the business context; problem solving, analysing and critical thinking; communication theory.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: Skills and capabilities based on theoretical knowledge in the areas of written, oral, interpersonal and group communication. The content of the course is at all stages made relevant to the students needs both for their course of study and their role in the workplace.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to the basics of computer programming to equip students for a career in any branch of IT, the sciences, data analysis or engineering. The fundamentals of writing, designing and testing programs will be developed.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: Provides a wide-ranging, multidisciplinary introduction to the evolution and application of increasingly complex and powerful computer systems (and other forms of digital technology) with particular emphasis on their impact on society.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: Provides an introduction to IT infrastructure concepts in order to enable students to understand computer systems architecture for effective configuration and use. Concepts of single user, multi-user, centralised, and operating systems are covered, along with applications and end-user computing.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to an Object-Oriented approach to problem solving. The fundamentals of design, development and testing of Object-Oriented programs is covered.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: Provides an introduction to a number of scripting languages and demonstrates the kind of problems these languages are especially suited for. Various practical and often interactive problem-solving situations are discussed and the use of scripting in solving these is demonstrated.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to applied statistics. Topics include: summary statistics, plotting data, the Normal distribution, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, basic statistical computing, simulation, regression, correlation, analysis of variance, and the detection of outliers.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An outline of organic functional group chemistry commonly found in biological molecules.  The chemistry, functions and metabolism of carbohydrates, lipids, proteins and nucleic acids; enzymes; immunochemistry; blood chemistry and body fluids; hormones and neurotransmitters; biochemical techniques.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to the classification, bacterial anatomy and physiology, cultivation, staining and identification of micro-organisms.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to the methods of microbial classification and nomenclature; the morphological and biochemical characteristics of bacteria, yeast and moulds with emphasis on groups of particular industrial and environmental importance; identification of micro-organisms.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to general and organic chemistry:  atoms and bonding, chemical reactions, states of matter, oxidation and reduction, acids and bases, spectrophotometry, reaction rates, organic functional groups, aliphatic and aromatic hydrocarbons, oxygenated organic compounds.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An introduction to the fundamentals of the chemistry of organic compounds: structure, bonding and reactions of the major functional groups; occurrence, uses and synthesis of organic compounds using selected examples of natural and synthetic materials.

qualification_name: Bachelor of Computer & Information Sciences and Bachelor of Science
prescriptor: An understanding of the nature and properties of foods and the nutritional requirements of humans; the major causes of food spoilage; an overview of major food processing procedures.
